abstract: Saturday Profile of Dr Aroup Chatterjee, London-based physician, raised in India, who has become one of most vocal critics of late Mother Teresa's work in Kolkata and her role in city's image as one of most desperate places on earth; Chatterjee's aim has become more difficult as Mother Teresa is set to be declared saint in September.
lead_paragraph: Dr. Aroup Chatterjee has spent hundreds of hours researching the soon-to-be saint. “I just thought that this myth had to be challenged,” he said.

headline.print_headline: Critic’s Lonely Quest: Contesting Mother Teresa Myth
headline.main: A Critic’s Lonely Quest: Revealing the Whole Truth About Mother Teresa
